item.title: Promote moderately diversified economic development
item.description: Macao opportunities and responsibilities from the perspective of young entrepreneurship Wun Kong Law * Kacee Ting Wong ** It is a widely recognized fact that the Macao game sector is under increasing pressure from the emergence of new game centers in neighboring regions. Even more worrying is the so -called “exclusion effect” caused by the excessive preponderance of the game industry, which makes it difficult to attract talent and the growth of game -related sectors, generating structural imbalances and obscuring the prospects of sustainable economic development. At this key transition moment, Macao must break decisively with the habit of rooted dependence over the years and adopt an innovation posture and initiative to promote moderate economic diversification. This way is not just the right way to ensure robust long-term development, but it is an inevitable strategic choice for Macao to be proactively in the new competitive scenario. The strong commitment of the Government of the Special Administrative Region (MSAR) in the development of Mountain Island (Hengqin) and support for local entrepreneurs demonstrates that economic diversification has become one of the priorities of current governance. For a long time, the high profits from the game sector generated, in some individuals and local companies, a dependence mindset, leading to a passive attitude of waiting for opportunities within the game's value chain, to the detriment of an active exploitation of new emerging sectors. This conservative mindset, resembling invisible currents, not only limits Macao's progress on the way to economic diversification and social innovation, but also weakens its ability to resistance to external shocks. It deserves attention that certain companies remain too faithful to their traditional operational models, neglecting the formation of their innovation capacity and improving their adaptation to market dynamics. Once the external environment changes, they are severely affected, highlighting the urgency of transforming mental models and welcoming a culture of renewal. Therefore, we argue that the commitment of business fabric in promoting economic diversification is as essential as - or even more pressing - the efforts of the government government to reduce the dependence of the game sector. Young local entrepreneurs and small and medium enterprises should assume a central role, breaking with the mindset of comfort and becoming the driving force of industrial transformation and innovative development. A paradigmatic example is that of Mr. Fu Tanglong, president of the Macao Digital Industry Research Institute and Executive Vice President of the Macao Living Transmission Association. Since the beginning of the Great Bay initiative in 2019, Mr. Fu has decided to launch himself inside China to undertake, moved by his confidence in electronic trade, actively exploring the economic opportunities provided by new technologies. Through its training programs, it assisted more than 350 small and medium -sized companies in its digital conversion and provided training in digital marketing and in -moving transmission to about 4,000 young people. This practice demonstrates well the entrepreneurial spirit that combines the courage to explore the strategic vision with the use of comparative advantages. His success experience proves that, with proper professional training and taking advantage of Macao's unique geographical position and political environment, young people can open new horizons in electronic trade, developing personal careers and contributing to the region's economic transformation. In 2023 alone, the Mr. FU -led association helped Macao's local traders reach a sales volume of over $ 16 million (source: macaubusiness.com, December 10, 2024, “the entrepreneurship journey of a young man from Macao”). Other inspiring examples of young entrepreneurs abound. Mrs. Huang Yin has been dedicated to the promotion and dissemination of traditional Chinese medicine in the territory; Mrs. Chan Nga Law, in turn, founded the company E.C. Film Production Company Limited, contributing in recent years to the development of the Macao film industry; And young talents like Leng Ka Chan and Oscar Chan Tianlan were elected in August 2024 by Macau Post as "great bay excellence entrepreneurs." These young entrepreneurs, actively exploring the unique cultural and historical resources of Macao and developing projects with strong local identity, prove the immense potential of innovation anchored in tradition. These success cases are inspired by companies to reinforce investment in research and development, valuing Macau's historical-cultural heritage and combining their traditional specificities with contemporary creativity, with a view to creating innovative products with macanese identity. The active response of these individuals to the “Moderately Diversified Economic Development Plan 2024–2028” and the Government of the Government guidelines represents, in practice, the realization of the “four hopes” expressed by President XI Jinping in December 2024: to boost moderate diversification of the economy; Raise the effectiveness of governance of the special administrative region; Build opening platforms to the highest level outside; and safeguard social stability and harmony. Strategic attention attributed to the development of Mountain Island clearly reflects the prominent place that economic diversification occupies in the current governance. According to statistical data, the Guangdong-Macau in-depth cooperation zone in Hengqin already hosts more than 56,000 commercial entities and more than 10,000 technological companies, constituting a fundamental pillar for Macao's economic transformation. The new Government of MSA has attributes great importance to the expansion of economic and commercial relations with Portuguese -speaking countries, having foreseen, in its first year, an official mission to Portugal. Secretary for Economics and Finance, Mr. Tai Kin IP, recently stressed that the role of Macao as a bridge between China and Lusophone countries is irreplaceable. It also reiterated that the region will enhance its connection platform, with emphasis on the development of the technological industry as a strategic vector to achieve economic diversification (China Daily, June 27, 2025). It is also important to mark the growing role of macanese students in Portugal, who have become dynamic protagonists of the exchange between Chinese and Portuguese societies. Promoting a renewal of mentalities requires the collective effort of all sectors of Macanese society and a coordinated advance on multiple fronts. Individual, Macao residents should cultivate a prospective view, break with conventional professional models and acquire emerging sectors specialized skills such as digital economy, creative industries or traditional Chinese medicine, continually reinforcing their competitive advantage. Companies, as protagonists of economic development, should abandon passivity, adopt a proactive posture of transformation, reinforce investments in technological innovation and product investigation, and strengthen cooperation with the interior of China and international markets. At the same time, they should seek to deepen their connections with the large bay and the outdoor markets, converting Macao's advantages as a platform into concrete business opportunities. In fact, the private sector, for its efficiency, flexibility and competitive orientation, plays a particularly relevant role in the realization of economic diversification. Nevertheless, it is undeniable that many companies face the problem of high financing costs, which can limit their investment capacity - as has been widely discussed, including academic publications such as the Blue Sky Blog of Columbia University Law School. To respond to this difficulty, the Government of MSA has launched the “Young Entrepreneurship Support Plan”, offering interest-free loans to young people with entrepreneurial spirit but with limited resources, thus providing them with substantial support. This measure translates the governance view of paving the way to youth and reinforces the social consensus that young people should take advantage of this favorable conjuncture and get out of their “comfort zone”. Most importantly, young people, who live this crucial moment of transition, must consciously assume the historical mission of leading Macao towards a model of sustainable and diverse economic development. Instead of questioning “what can Macau do for me?”, Should question “What can I do for Macau and my country?”, Cultivating an attitude of initiative and service, making national and regional prosperity its vocation. The new generation should break free from the dependence on a single job in the game sector and widen their professional horizons, betting on continuous learning and improving their skills-not only as a requirement for personal development, but also as imperative to optimize the region's talent structure and promote social progress. From the national strategic point of view, the development of Hengqin will also contribute to the deep integration of Macao in the Great Bay. The firm and continuous application of President Xi Jinping's important guidelines will allow Macau to safely follow the right path traced by national policies towards a promising and predictable future. As history teaches us, the periods of difficulty are also aptly moments for consensus consolidation and overcoming with determination. Macao is in a historic crossroads. Breaking with inertia, renewing concepts and redefining the course of development is not just urgent - it is unavoidable. In this context of transformation, we must all firmly support the policies of the Government of MSAR in the economic and social domains. Given the inevitable challenges of economic transition, the Macanese society must unite, strive with conviction in the process of diversification, and promote, with innovative spirit and social cohesion, the modernization of the productive structure. If, as Dickens wrote, the worst times are also the best, then Macanese entrepreneurs should not lose confidence in the face of adversities, but will face them with courage and creativity, adopting innovative management models capable of responding to the challenges of economic transition and technological progress. Society as a whole should abandon immobilism, face changes with bravery and turn difficulties into opportunities. Only with the concerted action of individuals, companies and authorities will it be possible to take steady steps on the moderately diverse economic development, writing a new chapter in the history of Macao - a lasting prosperity chapter and sustainable progress. *President of the Macao Legal Promotion Association and senior consultant for Think Tank “Chinese Dream” ** Lawyer, associate investigator at the Hong Kong Basic Law Studies Center and Macao at Shenzhen University, president of Think Tank “Chinese Dream” and deputy of the Hong Kong District Council

item.title: The cracker that challenges repression
item.description: Hungary has recently banned LGBTQia+marches, further deepening its authoritarian and conservative drift under the government of Viktor Orbán. This decision is not only an attack on human rights - it is also a direct reflection of ignorance and fear in the face of diversity. In response, about 200,000 people took to the streets of Budapest to celebrate pride. Under the risk of being detained and even facing prison penalties up to a year, they were proudly fearless, convinced that they are on the right side of the story. In this context, it is worth revisiting a simple but powerful didactic tool that has been used in schools and educational spaces for years to explain the complexity of human identity: GenderBread Person, a pun with gingerbread - the ginger ginger cookie. The ginger person is a graphic representation that uses this figure of American popular culture - the head ginger cookie, trunk and limbs - to uncomplicate often misunderstood concepts: gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation and biological sex. Through this friendly figure, it is taught that these four dimensions are distinct but interconnected-and that, above all, do not fit rigid binarisms. Unfortunately, for leaders like Orbán and for so many others in the world, this nuance is precisely what scares the most. In a world where human diversity becomes increasingly visible, the response of certain governments has been silencing and repression. They face him like a threat. Hungary, by banning the marches of LGBTQIA+pride, is not just denying public space to a vulnerable community - is denying its own social reality. Genderbread explains things that should be simple: a person can be born with male biological characteristics, identify himself as a woman, express himself in a non-binary manner, and feel attraction to another man. It is a factual description of human complexity. In Hungary, in 2021 a law was passed that prohibits the “promotion” of LGBTQIA+ content with minors, in a clear attempt to associate gender identity and sexual orientation with taboo themes. The logic is old and spent: if we don't talk about, you may disappear. But LGBTQia+ people are not modern inventions - they are part of humanity forever. Denying their existence does not eliminate them; It only aggravates suffering, isolation and reinforces the urgency of resistance. Europe has been watching, in recent years, a dangerous growth of populist movements that feed hatred and exclusion. Hungary is just an example of how this discourse can become state policy. Educating for diversity is the most effective antidote against extremism. Teaching children (and adults) that being different is not wrong, that the genre is not just about the binary man-man, and that love does not know rules imposed by ideologies-all this is a way to build more just and more human societies. The fear that these leaders demonstrate is no more than refusing to accept the complexity of the human condition. Their ideological rigidity prevents them from recognizing that individual freedom and diversity are not threats-they are fundamental pillars of a healthy society. Today, more than ever, we need more ginger people in schools - and less stone leaders in the governments of this world.

item.title: Highly qualified investigator delivers food (I)
item.description: Recently, the online press has widely released the history of Chinese academic, Ding Yuanzhao (丁遠昭). In 2004, Ding Yuanzhao got 700 points out of 750 in the admission exam to higher education in mainland China and joined Tsinghua University to take baccalaureate in chemical and bio-industrial engineering. After graduation, he was admitted to the University of Beijing and made his master's degree in Energy Resources Engineering. Later, he obtained his doctorate in biology at the Nanyang Technology University in Singapore. In 2018, he joined Oxford University in the United Kingdom to take a master's degree in biodiversity. Subsequently, he worked as a researcher in a postdoctoral degree at the National University of Singapore. In March 2024, the contract as an investigator came to an end, was not renewed, and Ding started working as a food delivery in Singapore. It works 11 or 12 hours a day, and earns an average of $ 50 to $ 100 (about $ 40 to $ 80) and can earn up to 254 dollars of Singapore (about 200 US dollars) on Sundays. This case caused a wide debate after Ding filmed and loaded a video on the internet. In the video, it showed the various academic certificates and advised candidates for joining the universities of mainland China, as follows: "The results of the exams are not everything. Do not get pessimistic if they do not have good grades. The good results do not mean that they will have the future guaranteed. The works are not very different. Food deliveries is a good choice to serve society and to support, just work hard that we are rewarded." In another video, Ding advises experts to pay attention to the safety of people who deliver food. Ding's case caused a lighted discussion in Chinese society. The main reason is the disparity between its academic level and its current profession. This disparity draws attention to the problem of cultural conflict in Chinese society. Since the most remote times, China has always been focused on education. Cultured people can serve as members of the government and give wide to all their ambition. Another purpose of education is to cultivate the character, so there is a saying that says “training begins with learning and learning with reading.” (立身以立學為先 ， 立學以讀書為本) In Europe, education focuses on the transmission of knowledge and encouraging students to think independently and innovatively. Universities are the bastion of knowledge and particularly value scientific research. Scientific research leads to innovation and innovation benefits society. This is the main objective of education, which has no relation to careers that many students choose after graduation. Ding became a food delivery man after obtaining a doctorate. This disparity between formation and the current profession collides with the principles of traditional Chinese culture and it is inevitable that it has caused lit debates. This case is not only a story, but also a mirror that reflects issues such as the meaning of education, social values ​​and personal attitudes. First, having passed a university researcher the food delivery, will Ding have questioned the usefulness of having obtained several academic degrees? Why go to the university? To answer this question, we cannot only consider personal experience, but a social perspective. Knowledge is a personal property. It is not measured in terms of money, but in the evolution it causes in humans. Students receive education at the university to obtain more knowledge, to inherit an “intangible” property and enrich their spirits. The knowledge obtained at the University becomes professional knowledge, so professionals, such as doctors, lawyers and accountants, have to receive university education. After acquiring professional knowledge, the right way will be to embrace a profession where they give good use to the training they received. Only with talented and specialized people can social development exist, and only with talented and specialized researchers can new inventions emerge, which is also very necessary in all societies. Therefore, students who received university education should pursue careers other than those who have not received it and it is impossible for “future work to be not that different.” Ding has a doctorate and is a person with a high degree of education. Working as a food delivery is obviously the result of a maladjustment between your formation and your current profession; This maladjustment results in the waste of talented people and society loses it. Ding's difficulty in finding a work compatible with his academic qualifications was a matter of lack of opportunities and was part of his life course. When in the future you find a work worthy of your background, you can again use your knowledge and learn to make them useful. Therefore, it is not correct to confuse the objective of education with the circumstances of life. Next week, we will continue to deepen this story. item.title: HALFTONE | New issue of the magazine presented today at FRC
item.description: Halftone - Macau Photography Association today presents, from 6.30 pm, at the Rui Cunha Foundation, the 12th edition of its magazine Halftone, a publication dedicated to photography. The new number has six visual projects, two of them black and white, which open and close the magazine. Jane Xu's first, who is entitled “Black Enlivened by Colors”, offers a portrait of female intimacy, in line with the artist's visual practice and his thematic research. In a different way, but still black and white, João Palla concludes in this number of the magazine the second part of his project “White Gold Whispers”. “The poetic expression of its visual proposal articulates perfectly with the aesthetic effect obtained with the contrast between black and white,” says the event organization The four other visual projects, in color, test different approaches to chromatic and thematic composition. Jorge Veiga Alves presents “Memories of Macau”, seeking to reinforce the memory effect in the approach to the contemplation of traditional spaces, namely religious in nature. Field and city José Luís de Sales Marques' second color project is dedicated to the famous procession of Senhor dos Passos, which takes place in Macau, underlining the role of this event, not only in the social and cultural context of the city, but also in its integration into the public space of Macao. In the third project, António Duarte Mil-Homens presents us a contemplative time in “Sunset, Moonrise”, addressing the nature and essence of the Alentejo landscape. The succession of color marks the hours and differentiates impressions, which conform the immensity of the Alentejo plain and its morphology. In the fourth project, color also plays a key role in its expressiveness and visual conformation: Tang Kuok Hou's “photosynthesis” proposes a social and aesthetic exploitation of the city of Macao, reinforcing its role as a place of photographic study par excellence, which has justified a multitude of various approaches, both thematic and sociological or formal, given its expressive richness.

item.title: CCM | Chopin and Debussy close season of the Macau Orchestra
item.description:
On July 27, the Macao Cultural Center hosts the concert that ends the 2024-2025 season of the Macao Orchestra. The show will bring together conductor Lio Kuokman and Korean pianist Kun-Woo Paik, on a night when Chopin, Tchaikovsky and Debussy will be heard compositions of Chopin, Tchaikovsky
From the South Korea arrives, at the end of the month, pianist Kun-Woo Paik, to stage the conductor of the Macau Orchestra (OM), Lio Kuokman. Together they will star in the “Closing Concert of the Macau 2024-25 Orchestra Concerts Season”, where a “Chopin masterpiece” is presented, but also compositions by Claude Debussy. The show takes the stage of the Great Auditorium of the Macao Cultural Center (CCM) on July 27, from 20h, combining the mastery of two names used to the beauty of classical music. Note that Lio Kuokman, besides the main conductor of OM, is also a musical director of the same. At the concert, and according to a note from the Cultural Institute (IC) on the show, presents “a selection of sublime works, providing music lovers with an unforgettable musical will”. In this concert, Paik will interpret the “Concert for Piano and Orchestra No. 2 in Chopin Form”, composed between 1829 and 1830 and which debuted in Vienna on March 17, 1830. Here the South Korean pianist should reveal “his virtuosural technique”. The OM will also present the “prelude to the nap of a faun” by Debussy, a composition made between 1892 and 1894 that is based on a poem by Stéphane Mallarmé. This piece was first played live in Paris, Société Nationale de Musique, on December 22, 1894. The Concert of July 27 also includes Tchaikovsky's famous “Symphony No. 5 in Mi Minor”, ​​Russian composer of the so-called romantic period, thus ending the season “with striking and emotional classic works”. An early debut Kun-Woo Paik made his debut as a soloist at the Korea National Symphony Orchestra at the age of ten, and his studies and artistic career in various countries in Europe and America went on, obtaining excellent results in multiple prominent music contests. His family already had music connections, since Paik's father is a violinist and his mother teacher. When he made his debut on stage, Paik executed Edvard Grieg's “Concert for Piano”. The pianist collaborated with several orchestras and conductors of world renowned, consolidated as one of the main masters of the piano, and edited several critically acclaimed albums. In 2000, he was awarded by the French government with the title of “Knight of the Order of Arts and Letters”, in recognition for his artistic contribution. Since the 1970s, the South Korean pianist has lived in Paris. Tickets are on sale and prices range from 180 to 400 patacas.

item.title: Smuggling | Seized boat with 34 million in goods

item.title: Black Sand | Ready to use apartments
item.description:
The Exchange Housing Complex intended for Pearl Horizon injured is about to receive the first residents. Macau Urban Renewal has announced that the six apartment blocks have already been licensed for use and that the next step will be to deliver the fractions to buyers
Almost 10 years later, part of the solution to one of the most intense real estate -related controversies in Macao is in sight, which involved cases in court, demonstrations and even applications to the Legislative Assembly. Pearl Horizon's injured buyers are about to occupy fractions in buildings built on the same terrain, this time under the aegis of Macau Urban Renewal (MRU). The public capital company announced that the housing project to exchange in the P Lot P of the new landfills of the sand called Pearl Metropolitan, completed the inspection and licensing phase for use. According to MRU, the next step will be to advance with the delivery procedures of houses to buyers. The “Pearl Metropolitan is composed of six 50 -story apartment blocks, providing 2,064 autonomous fractions. At the end of March, the MRU indicated that from a total of 1,923 calls qualified to buy apartments in the complex, 1,880 had already chosen apartments. The company highlights the “superior geographical location” of the housing complex which, besides being next to the river, is close to access to the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge, the Macao Bridge, the Qingmao borders and siege doors, as well as the Macao airport and the outdoor passenger maritime terminal. All included Each apartment block is equipped with four elevators. The parking lot has 1,873 seats for cars and 490 seats for motorcycles, equipped with electric vehicle recharge points. In addition, “Pearl Metropolitan” has Clubhouse, pool, gym and outdoor park, along an area with over 16,000 square meters. The recreation zone also has a playground and running route about 700 meters. The apartments are from the T1, T2 and T3 typology, with areas between 57 and 135 square meters, all have balconies and have all cooking and bathroom equipment. It is recalled that in the same lot are the residences for the elderly of the government, as well as the temporary housing for residents of the six IAO Hon-degraded public housing buildings that will be the subject of renewal. item.title: Retail | SASA's business rises 7.7% due to increased tourism
item.description: The Cosmetics retail company SASA registered in the second quarter of this year an annual rise in the turnover of stores in Macau and Hong Kong of 7.7 percent, to a total of $ 687.4 million from Hong Kong. In a note sent to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, the company justifies the results with the “arrival of tourists to the group's main market, Hong Kong and Macau, who continued to recover, leading to an improvement in offline turnover”. Store product sales increased 11.2 percent in the special administrative regions in the second quarter of the year. Overall, the results of the retail sales group were more modest, with an annual climb of 4.7 percent turnover for a total of $ 959.8 million from Hong Kong. The group's activity suffered from loss of sales in the interior of China, where operations went to online after the end of all stores in the country. Sasa faced less than a sixth in the interior of China than in Hong Kong and Macao, with online sales fall 19.2 percent in annual terms to a total of $ 109.2 million from Hong Kong.

item.title: Real Estate | Government accused of leaving sector “dying”
item.description:
The president of the Macao Real Estate Agents Association regrets that the government has ignored the situation of owners in the face of the devaluation of the real estate and that it has left the sector on the verge of extinction. Franky Fong suggests the elimination of notarial rates and taxes on real estate transactions
The president of the Macao Real Estate Real Estate Agents Association (official name), Franky Fong, is not satisfied with how the government has dealt with the sector crisis. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, the representative lamented that, despite the "excellent results" of the game industry and the increase in the volume of tourists, "the government has ignored the real estate sector, which is in a dying state, as well as the owners affected by the devaluation of real estate, which made them poorest." From the perspective of the leader and businessman in the field, the government could take several measures to reverse the situation. To begin with, the SAM Hou Fai Executive could change the law that regulates the real estate mediation activity, updating or eliminating excessive penalties and costly regulations. Franky Fong argues that the law should have a penalty mechanism that applies fines and other penalties according to the severity of the offenses, so that agents have more opportunities to correct light failures. Make way Another way to stimulate the real estate sector, may undergo tax reduction, such as seal on the transmission of property and building contribution, and the weight of expenses, such as notarial charges, associated with the purchase and sale of real estate. Franky Fong does not agree that notarial charges are calculated according to the value of the property transaction, instead of having a fixed fee, as it turns out in Hong Kong where notarial and registration costs can range from a few hundred Hong Kong dollars, he said. Regarding fiscal policy, the official argues that only fractions inhabited under the lease agreement are subject to the collection of a building contribution. On the other hand, the associative leader advocates the facilitation of bank loans for home purchase, namely by reducing the entrance ratio, or through credit plans with bonuses. Currently, the maximum mortgage loan ratio is 70 percent and the amount of 30 percent of the house price. Franky Fong points out that both in Hong Kong and the interior of China, flexibility measures have been applied that allow the acquisition of housing without such a high capital entrance. For the associative leader, the return of the Macao residence setting policy by investment would be another measure of capacity to inject new energy and capital in the market and the local economy.

item.title: Tourists | 20 million mark hit a month before
item.description:
More than 20 million tourists have visited Macau since the beginning of the year. The brand was exceeded yesterday morning, 26 days earlier than in 2024. So far, the daily average of entries this year has been 106 thousand visitors. More than 90 percent arrive from the interior of China and Hong Kong
Compared to 2024, Macao reached this year the milestone of 20 million tourists entering the territory almost a month earlier. According to data released yesterday by the Public Security Police (CPSP), the 20 million tourists who crossed the border to Macau was beaten at 11am yesterday, 26 days earlier than last year. Made the accounts, this total registration gives a daily average of 106,000 tourists. If the average tourists visiting Macau daily is added to the city's population, visitors represent 13.35 percent of people in the territory. CPSP data also show that among tourists who visited Macau since the beginning of the year, until yesterday at the end of the morning, 90.7 percent came from the interior of China and Hong Kong. Unsurprisingly, visitors from the countryside are the vast majority, 71.6 percent, followed by Hong Kong (19.1 percent), while Taiwan came 2.4 percent of visitors. International tourists represented only 6.9 percent of all entries since the beginning of the year. In terms of entry points, the siege door border post remains the busiest, totaling 41 percent of tourist entrances, followed by the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau border with 24.1 percent and 13.5 percent hengqin. Between the times According to data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC), in the first five months of this year 16.3 million tourists came to Macao, the second highest amount ever for a year, only surpassed by registration between January and May 2019 -before the COVID -19 pandemic -during which it recorded almost 17.2 million visitors. Combaging DSEC and CPSP data, it is concluded that during June and the first week of July, about 3.7 million people entered. The CPSP added yesterday that it expects the number of tourists to increase during the summer holidays. As such, it reinforced cooperation with the immigration and border inspection departments of the interior of China and Hong Kong to ensure safe, ordered and unsuccessful crossings.

item.title: Burlas | Elderly woman detained for helping criminals

item.title: Taiwan | Beijing applies export controls to military companies
item.description: China yesterday imposed export controls on eight Taiwan defense companies, as it aims, according to Beijing, to protect national security, the day they start the largest military maneuvers on the island. Restrictions affect entities such as the industrial Aerospace Development Corporation (AIDC), IDF Fighter manufacturer, Taiwan's largest Naval Naval Construtora, CSBC Corporation, and the main center of defense investigation of the island, the National Institute of Chung-Shan Science and Technology, among other companies of aerospace and naval sectors. The new rules, with immediate effect, prohibit exports to these “double -use goods” companies, that is, with civil and military applications, according to a statement from the Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The decision also includes, according to the same source, in the international non-village obligations assumed by Beijing. The announcement comes on the day of starting the Han Kuang military exercises, which simulate a response to a possible invasion of China and which, this year, take place over ten days, involving 22,000 reservists, in the largest and longer military exercise performed by the island. Despite sanctions, the target companies have ensured that the impact on their operations will be limited, as most supply chains do not depend on mainland China.

item.title: EU | China rejects interference in the relationship with Russia
item.description: The Chinese government yesterday rejected interference with its relations with Russia, after the president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, appealed to Beijing to end his “unshakable support” to Moscow in the war against Ukraine. "Normal cooperation between China and Russia does not admit interference from third parties," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning said at a press conference. Mao assured that the ties between Beijing and Moscow "are not directed against any third part." The statements arise in response to criticism from von der Leyen, who said the day before, during a debate in the European parliament, that "the unshakable support of China to Russia is creating great instability and insecurity for Europe." "We can say that, in practice, China is allowing Russia's war economy - and this is not acceptable," said the leader of the community executive, stressing that the way Beijing continues to interact with the Vladimir Putin war will be determining for the future of relations between the European Union (EU) and China. Von der Leyen is expected to visit Beijing in late July, accompanied by European Council Chairman António Costa for a summit who will mark the 50 years of diplomatic relations between the two parties.

item.title: Hunan | Discovered deposit with 490 million tons of lithium and other minerals
item.description: China, the second country in the world with largest identified lithium reserves, discovered a new deposit with about 490 million tons of this and other minerals, the state press yesterday. According to the Provincial Department of Natural Resources, the deposit was located in the Jijiaoshan Minas Gerais zone, in the municipality of Linwu, in the central province of Hunan, and contains approximately 1.31 million tons of lithium oxide, as well as rubidio, tungsten and tin. The discovery resulted from years of prospecting and the application of new geological exploration technologies, said the Hunan Mineral Resources Measurement Institute, quoted by the Chinese Official News Agency Xinhua. According to Xu Yiming, a professor at the Institute, the resources found should support the development of the new energy industry in the city of Chenzhou, also located in Hunan. According to data from the Chinese Ministry of Natural Resources, China recently exceeded the United States and became the second country in the world with the largest identified lithium reserves behind Bolivia, with an increase of 16.5 percent compared to 2024. The discovery occurs at a time when China intensifies efforts to explore domestic resources, with the aim of reinforcing energy security and access to strategic raw materials, in a context of growing global mineral competition such as lithium, crucial for the production of batteries used in electric vehicles.

item.title: Red Sea | China denies having pointed to laser the German plane
item.description: China yesterday refused Berlin's accusation that he pointed to a laser to a German plane in the Red Sea, considering these allegations "completely incompatible with the facts." "Both parties should adopt a pragmatic attitude, reinforce communication in a timely manner and avoid misunderstandings and calculation errors," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said. Germany said on Tuesday that an airplane plane was shot on July 2 by a Chinese laser in the Red Sea. China's ambassador to Berlin was summoned by the German Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The plane was participating in Operation Aspides from the European Union to protect maritime traffic against the attacks of the Houthis rebels in Yemen. The German plane was targeted by the laser “for no reason or prior contact” by a Chinese war ship during a routine surveillance flight, according to a German Ministry of Defense spokesman. Using the laser, the Chinese ship “risked people and equipment in danger,” he added, without specifying the nature of the used laser. Mao Ning indicated that Chinese ships perform escort missions in the Gulf of Aden and Somalis waters, "thus contributing to the safety of international maritime routes."

item.title: Commerce | Consumer prices rise 0.1% in June
item.description: China's consumer price index rose 0.1 percent in June, in homologous terms, the first increase after four consecutive months of descents, the country's statistical agency yesterday indicated. The data surprised the analysts, who predicted a new price contraction, after a 0.1 percent drop in May. According to Dong Lijuan, statistical of the National Statistics Office, the measures adopted by the government to stimulate internal demand and encourage consumption “continued to have an effect” in June. The second largest world economy remains under deflationary pressure due to the combination of poor internal demand and excessive industrial capacity, aggravated by trade war with the United States, which has hindered the flow of inventories accumulated by companies. Deflation (annual drop in consumer prices) reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly severe, as a drop in assets, as a rule contracted with credit, generates an imbalance between the value of bank loans and guarantees. Pathway Chinese authorities have reiterated that reinforcement of internal demand will be one of the central economic priorities for 2025. The same source also released the price index in the producer, which measures the prices to exit the factory, and which accentuated the 3.3 percent drop in May to 3.6 percent in June, the lowest value since July 2023. The descent was higher than market forecasts, which pointed to a lower contraction. Dong Lijuan warned that some export -oriented industries are “under pressure” in terms of price and “uncertainty in global trade has affected the expectations of exporting companies”. item.title: Red Sea | Germany accuses China of pointing out laser to the military plane
item.description: The German government yesterday accused China of having pointed to a laser to a German military plane on a mission in the Red Sea to protect maritime traffic against Huthis attacks, adding to the Chinese ambassador. "The danger to German personnel and the interruption of the mission is completely unacceptable," said the Ministry of German Foreign Affairs on social networks, specifying that the plane participated in the "Aspides" mission of the European Union (EU) in the Red Sea. The mission aims to ensure the maritime safety of I launched in 2024 to ensure unimpeded navigation routes in the Red Sea, Gulf of Aden, Arabic Mar, Gulf of Oman and Persian Gulf. However, these “overshadowing lasers” are not used to detect targets for subsequent missile shots, but only to interrupt aircraft operation.

item.title: DANS | Alert due to the typhoon that made two dead in Taiwan
item.description: Several provinces in eastern China were yesterday on alert due to the arrival of the typhoon Danas, now weakened for tropical storm, which left at least two dead and more than 600 injured in Taiwan. According to the forecasts, Danas will pass through southern Zhejiang and then move through the neighboring provinces of Fujian and Jiangxi, throughout this Wednesday, gradually reducing their speed of the current 75 kilometers per hour (km/h) to 35 km/h. In addition to the strong winds, the Chinese authorities warned that some of the zones where the typhoon will pass may receive rainfall of up to 350 millimeters. This may result, according to China's meteorological administration, in flooding in mountainous and urban areas or in small and medium rivers to extravate the beds. Several cities on the southeastern coast of China have announced prevention measures for the arrival of Danas, with Fujian authorities to also suspend several ferry routes that connect the continent to several islands. Similarly, in Shanghai (east), located just over 300 kilometers north of the point where Danas is expected to touch Terra, the local government warned citizens to the possibility of strong gusts of wind and sudden rainfall. Danas hit Taiwan at dawn on Sunday with winds of over 220 km/h, causing damage mainly in the southern part of the island and causing more than 5,000 incidents of diverse severity throughout the territory, where about 700,000 homes felt cuts in the supply of electricity.

item.title: Tianshui | Eight detainees after detection of lead in the blood of 233 children in daycare
item.description: Tianshui Chinese city authorities in the northwestern province of Gansu arrested eight people under an investigation into a case of lead poisoning, which affected 233 children from a private day care. The investigation concluded that those responsible for the nursery will have authorized the use of inappropriate substances for human consumption in the preparation of food for children, the CCTV state television said yesterday. Two people, with the nicknames ZHU and LI, responsible for the management and financing of the center, respectively, are among the detainees. According to the authorities, the center's cuisine used dyes purchased through the internet, which contained lead and were labeled with the warning that they were not suitable for consumption. Authorities reported that the 251 children attended the center were underwent blood analysis, of which 233 had abnormal lead levels and 18 were within the normal parameters. The intoxication led to the hospitalization of 201 children, CCTV said. In recent days, some parents of affected children have told local press that their children had suffered for months of symptoms such as nausea, diarrhea, leg pain or abdominal cramps and that in many cases they thought it was mild diseases until blood analyzes revealed the presence of lead. Private day care, inaugurated in 2022, charged about 6,000 yuan monthly enrollment for each child.

item.title: EU wants to rebalance relations with Beijing and avoid threats to safety and competitiveness
item.description: The president of the European Commission insisted yesterday that it is necessary to rebalance the relations with China, asking Beijing "predictability and confidence" to avoid threats to "security and competitiveness." “Predictability and confidence,” said Ursula Von Der Leyen during a debate on the relations between the European Union (EU) and China at the European Parliament Plenary (PE) in Strasbourg, France. The president of the community executive anticipated the summit between the political-economic bloc and a country that in five decades is no longer "a country of agriculture and today is an industrial colossus," and "one of the greatest global powers." Last week, Ursula Von Der Leyen met China's Foreign Minister in Brussels (Belgium), a city that houses the EU's main institutions, including the European Commission. "We are two of the three largest economies and powers in the world […], but we only exchanged about two billion euros a day [with China]. Although the market is huge, our access is limited," he said. The president of the European Commission has described a country that made “more than 800 million people out of poverty”, but which in the international geopolitical panorama has “real risks” to the EU, which are “strategic and systemic” and “harm the safety and competitiveness” of 27 community bloc countries. "China has a completely different system from ours and tools at your disposal that allows you to" throw "the margin of the rules […], subsidies not only to assist its industries, but also to suffocate competition," said Ursula Von Der Leyen. Look forward Demanding the rebalance of the economic balance between EU and Beijing, the “unambiguous condemnation” of the Russian invasion of Ukraine - which to this day has not done, although insisting that the sovereignty of all territories has to be respected - and containment in any “influence operations”, the president of the European Commission considered that the relationship between the two sides can only move forward, it is only “ rebalancing ”. “We have been doing together for a long time, if China is ready to work with a spirit of predictability and trust,” he insisted.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Macao Forum | Secretary-General says it has never discussed widening to Hispanic countries

The Secretary-General of the Macau Forum stated that the institution “never discussed” the creation of an entity to extend to Hispanic countries to promote economic cooperation similar to those that provide the connection between China and Portuguese-speaking countries. “Within the Macao Forum, we have never discussed this topic,” said the Forum Secretary-General for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries Ji Xianzheng. The official acknowledged that, "in society, there were some conversations to discuss or address the possibility of promoting more contact and cooperation with Spanish -language countries, but at the Forum level we have never addressed this theme." The Macao executive announced in mid -April the intention of creating a center to promote economic services between China and the Portuguese and Spanish languages ​​in the neighboring special Economic Zone of Hengqin. The idea is to provide companies in Hispanic countries services in the “linguistic, legal, fiscal, verification of compliance with norms, formation, arbitration and mediation”, according to the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong. Days earlier, the chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, had also announced the intention of “promoting exchange and cooperation” through Macao between China and the universe of Spanish -speaking countries. At the last ministerial conference, in April 2024, then Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Reis argued that the Portuguese Language China-Parais Cooperation and Development Fund should bet more on small and medium enterprises (SMEs). item.title: Filipe de Saavedra, Teacher: “A Camões Interpretative Center in Macau is missing”
item.description:
Professor at the University of Science and Technology of Macao and a scholar of the presence of Camões in Asia, Philip de Saavedra understands that Macau is missing an interpretative center about the poet's life and work. The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia
He participated yesterday at the “from Lisbon to Goa: What the Letters of Camões” participated. What path does the East arise portrayed in these letters, and who were directed? The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature. Some were written from Ternate, others from Malaca, Macau, probably others from Cambodia, to recipients in India and Portugal. With the exception of the letters of Goa, where the identification of the writing site is generally present, maping those that were written during the rest of it would be a complex task. They are only given as written in Asia. Can you give examples of written letters in this context? I mention here two of the first he sent to the kingdom. The epistle whose first line is “The Poet Simony speaking” was written in January 1554, when Camões has just arrived in Goa, destined for his pupil, D. António de Noronha. It is a very emotional letter, giving it the storm that had plagued the Armada in the Cape of Good Hope, "seeing the death of the before me." Camões survived this limit experience aboard the São Bento ship, the only one to arrive that year to Goa, and which was lost in the turn of the Christmas lands, dying in this second bid the Captain Fernão de Álvares Cabral, and many of those who traveled with him. In addition to the news of his salvation, the poet was equally eager to tell his friend the expedition of D. Afonso de Noronha to Malabar, in which he had taken part in the previous month. In Irenal pages, Camões vehemently condemns the massacre of the few native troops by the “thick armed” of the disproportionate vice-king army. In his radical compliment of peace, the poet calls "true remedy" to the early death that cure the war crazes of those who want to live "by knights", for "who will walk by following the fero Mars always brings their eyes to their danger." Cruelly prophetic words: by irony of fate, at the moment the poet wrote these lines and sent them, that recipient diletus, for whose life he feared, already lay, lying during a military foray in Ceuta on April 29, 1553, only 17 years old. And the second letter? A year later, in January 1555, he wrote to a friend a different epistle in tone and in purpose, whose first line is "I wished so much", where he evoked the shock he suffered from the death of D. António, gathering a sonnet that had composed to his memory. It is clear that Camões also had great intimacy with this correspondent, who knew D. António and the poetry of Camões, Petrarch and Boscán. item.title: Piménio Ferreira: “Anti-igan rhetoric has always worked in Portugal”
item.description: Piménio Ferreira, better known as Gitelles Ferreira, anti-racist militant, 34, physical engineer, national Romani. He is a man with a provocative speech, a corrosive, kind mood and a smile that leaves no one indifferent Gitelles, we live in an intercultural land and the Gypsies - in particular - have lived about five centuries in Portugal. What is going on for Gypsy communities to remain “on the fringes” of the so -called society? The model of society remains to be changed. This is extremely stratified by placing people in subordinate places to privilege a violent minority. The white social structure is patriarchal and racist. What is called the "margin" of society is actually an intrinsic place to it, which belongs to it. In other words, Gypsy people have been included in this model of society since they discovered Europe and its kingdoms. The problem is the model of society that is maintained and the place to which they were relegated and how they were relegated: with violence, in inferior status against whites, without the right to human dignity, to constitute a family, to choose one's own language and religion, expropriated from any and all cultural and material law. A place built and maintained to this day by violence and genocidal and ethnicidal persecution. In 1463, a Gitano Vasco was drowned to an estate. In 1521, Gitans, or Gypsies, were already used as a reference for all that is considered bad in the model of society. The "counter-exemple" in the face of the white that would stand out for the positive. The 'angel' and the 'devil'; the 'other', the enemy; That against whom any attack and persecution is legitimate. Including the prohibition of defending, having weapons, any kind of goods, and the right of permanence. And is it for them to be denied this right to permanence that we still have nomadic gypsy communities within the country? Yes, no doubt. There are many ways to force nomadism: directly, prohibiting permanence and expelling with police or military force; indirectly, refusing public or private housing to Gypsy people, as they are Gypsy; and even through the gentrification process. I read the result of an inquiry from the European Union Fundamental Rights Agency, which is said to be approximately 80% of the Gypsies responded to the risk threshold of poverty in their country; One in three Gypsies lives in a housing without channeled water; One in three Gypsies belongs to a family where someone hungry at least once the previous month; and 50% of Gypsies aged 6 to 24 do not attend school. Why does this happen like this? It is the historical persecution, which continues. There is no impoverishment that has no external cause. In this case, a political system of total expropriation and imposed on the basis of violence. Already in 1648, D John IV, the restorer, prohibited ‘Giving or Rent houses to Gypsies’. The same D John IV who got the kingdom of Portugal thanks to D. Jerónimo da Costa and his 250 knights. The same D. Jerónimo da Costa who had died to defend Portugal's independence from Castile. Gypsy, like his wife and children. Between prohibitions of permanence, “that do not enter Gypsies in the Kingdom and leave those who are” (D John III, 1526), ​​with expulsions, degred to the galleys, expropriation of goods and properties, imposed with stripping, mutilation and death, systematically performed to this day (still in 2011 Faro City Council wanted to ban Gypsies in the municipality). The prohibition of working on others (no one employs Gypsy workers, and those who accept they do it in total precariousness, for poorly paid positions and without decent rights and conditions). They cannot be dependent on their own work, they cannot get investment means due to extreme expropriation. Are dependent on precariousness. If you want to know what it is like to live in pure neoliberalism, know the lives of Gypsies. Their reality is paradigmatic of the aggression and depletion to which the "gentlemen" are willing to go to their benefit. What do you talk about is economic and political power? The group of political, social, cultural and economic power. The owner, the colonizer. This group that has been in power since it established the system of current domination. And that only makes sense within the hierarchically stratified sociopolitical model in which we live. Hence the need to end 'gentlemen' and institute a new model of society, healthy, free, without hierarchies or strata, whether of race, class or gender. The model we live in leads to the Gypsy (and not only) community to economic exclusion, removing it from access to product consumption or excluding them from its production process; political exclusion associated with lack of access to information; To education and consequently the social exclusion that is seen in inequality of access to quality community areas such as restaurants, libraries, theater, cinema, concerts, health care, etc. How do you feel a gypsy child when you realize that it is not part of a whole? Children who are never represented, neither in movies, nor in books, nor in cartoons, not even in an announcement to eat cereals, for example? Is this a disaster for self-esteem, is a priori condemnation? The question is that. Gypsy people are not “excluded from society”, by contrast, they are included in it. The problem is the existence of what is cynically called 'social exclusion', which term Orwellian, and there be under coercion, people. Which field of concentration and extermination. Incidentally, Nazi concentration camps are a more visual realization than called 'social exclusion' and, as here, were not a 'excluded' part of Nazi society, but rather its fundamental and characterizing structure. It is a place of violence, where people are maintained by violence, dedicated to their extermination, and designed so that few people can leave. And yet they resist. As in Nazi concentration camps. And what you have listed as an example of 'consequence' of this 'exclusion', is actually the means by which this exclusion also happens and remains. Gypsy people are out of theaters, both as consumers and producers (but go to the cinema). They are out of school, education and the gym. Either as 'users' or as producers (but go to school and are on the basis of knowledge construction and academic and scientific debates). Even in attacking Gypsy children's self -confidence, we talk about a maintenance mechanism of this situation. But Gypsy people respond very well: with Gypsy pride. Another resistance, another aggression. Gypsy people are thus included in society. In a place that belongs to this model of modern society. And they resist and contradict the power of domination and make a point of being in the city, in the cinema, in the theater, in the gym, in all spaces. With a lot of struggle and always resisting, but they are there. Social exclusion, more than a “place outside of society”, is part of its social structure. Do you want to say that there is a collective resistance? At work, already in a context of absolute precariousness, during the pandemic, Gypsy people rolled up sleeves and showed once again proactivity and creativity in adversity. They learned seeing and doing. And here, it is again the women who jump to the front line, face, learn to use digital tools with their daughters or children, and throw themselves into the network. And so they explore online sales as well as application by application (transportation or rehabs). In housing, in a context of pandemic in which the evictions were not locked - as they owed and dictated the law itself - residents did not fail to organize and fight unjust evictions and claim dignity in housing; associations of allied residents in their action with other housing and anti-racist struggle organizations. It should also be noted how they reinvented and intensified to raise and distribute dietary goods and kits of masks/alcohol gel to the most expropriated people. Gypsies and non -Gypsies. In the anti-racist struggle, new movements emerged and their actions intensified by social networks. People who had never been organized or militated before began their first steps in activism, thickening this way of the organization and popular gypsy and anti-racist action. People forget, or do not want to value, but Gypsy action has helped determine results in the political dispute. Gypsy citizens mobilized in large and determined electoral results in the municipalities of 2017, both in Alentejo and in the Lisbon Metropolitan Area, even causing electoral earthquakes. And even in the presidential, second place was resolved by a value equivalent to the estimated number of Gypsy voters. Apart from the non -Gypsy votes that were mobilized by the action of Gypsy voters. Gypsy people are even co-considering power in the spaces of opinion, local media, social networks and party and institutional political dispute. And most importantly, in the popular Ação and alliances with other social movements. We have never stopped fighting for all means and continuing to resist. In contrast there are more and more hate speeches, from the far right in particular. What do you have to say about it? To start these speeches are historical and European. Not even current and even less “of the far right”. These speeches have been adopted and rendered for a long time, even in 'democracy and freedom', by several representatives of the center right, conservatives, left center, liberal, liberal left, even representatives of the PCP. Anti-egana rhetoric has always worked in Portugal as it is the whiter rhetoric [white genesis]. That is, it allows you to create and give the "white" as the superior of all. And so please the white electorate who, when feeling well, pays off with his vote. Even if the policies implemented by their elected harm him even more. Finally, did you like them to talk a little about your personal experience and how did you get to the activist? I studied, fought for studies, made alliances, graduated, went in the labor market of the “formal precariousness”. I started my militant action and here I am today. We can transform this society a better. This certainty combined with the fact that the current one has so much suffering makes anyone want to have a transformist attitude. I wanted to be 'inventor' (physical engineer) and anti -racist militant. And through study (not necessarily schooling) and organization with others, in turn, with other studies, formations and visions, I learned how the world works and how it can be changed. But before transforming, we need to survive. Hence two types of actions arise: transformative and survival. The struggle against hate discourse arises as survival, but his defeat will be a transformative victory. There is a lot that - like people who want a better world - we have to do, namely working to criminalize hatred speech; condemn and prohibit organizations with racist discourses and practices; denounce the racist institutional structure and logics that organize power and generate community resources. And in this sense, there have been various types of actions, of petitions, to manifestations. And we need more. I, besides being a military man in the SOS Racism movement, participate in the “We came to stay” podcast, with Mamadou BA and Joseph da Silva. And if all goes well, we will soon start a new project. With friendly people, we also have the project “Gypsy Initiative”, dedicated to reflecting and promoting transformative movements. Essentially focused on educating against anti-agigarism, denouncing historical and continued genocide and working for a new society project. Also with new projects on the gutter. And finally, there are always voluntary actions without an organization, where I try to share what I found out about anti-egism and Roman history in schools and with interested people. In addition, there is still the struggle for housing, because the evictions did not stop during the pandemic. Due to housing and work precariousness, the subjects racialized especially the Roma nationals are the most vulnerable to COVID-19. There is essential to have actions in this area; Of all the struggles, this is the most structural, as it goes against one of the main enemies of a healthy society: the real estate speculation of this capitalist system, which places profit and goods above people and their humanization.

item.title: FIA | Conference helped perceive future of motorsport

item.title: GP | FIA AFINA REGIONAL Formula Rules
item.description: The International Automobile Federation (FIA) took advantage of the holding of the Extraordinary General Assemblies and its annual conference to publish the Macao Grand Prix Regulation - FIA Regional Formula Cup of 2025. There are not many changes compared to 2024, but the changes introduced aim to browse gaps from the first edition of this competition in Macau The twelve red flags during last year's qualification session called for the level of pilots at the Guide Circuit, which was the premiere of the FIA ​​regional formula in Macau regional formula. This happened after the controversial decision of the FIA ​​to consider that Formula 3 was no longer adequate to the Macao Citadino layout. Unsurprisingly, the sports regulation is now clear that, to compete in the FIA ​​regional formula world, “all pilots must have participated at least 3 competitions with a monolugar that has been projected and/or built to achieve a weight/power ratio of more than 3.0 kg/hp.” Emanuele Pirro, a former F1 pilot, winner of the Guide Race and president of the FIA ​​monoligai committee, said during the weekend of the 71st edition that, in the future, the FIA ​​will be more demanding about track discipline. Thus, from now on, “any pilot who, in the opinion of sports commissioners, is solely responsible for the display of a red flag during the qualification training session, will not be able to continue to participate in this session and its best time back can be annulled.” The new regulation also states that “if a qualification training session is interrupted with less than four minutes remaining, it will not be restarted.” On the other hand, the FIA ​​maintains the limit in the participation of more experienced pilots, except only “pilots who participated in a maximum of 3 FI F2 Championship competitions of 2025.” This measure goes a little against the spirit and history of the Great Prize, which has always gathered pilots from higher categories in its main race. In fact, this was a fervent question between Macao and the International Federation on two previous occasions. In 1985, Alfredo César Torres, then responsible for Portuguese motorsport, convinced Jean-Marie Balestre, against his will, to allow the participation of F1 pilots in the F3 Intercontinental Cup in the name of the economic viability of the race. In 2016, the controversy returned with the veto da FIA to the participation of Nelsinho Piquet, a decision badly received by the teams and then coordinator Barry Bland, which would eventually abandon the co-organization of the race a year later. Bet on continuity In sports terms, registrations for this second edition of the FIA ​​regional formula Cup will remain open until July 30. The grill may include a maximum of 27 Tatuus regional formula monologues, all equipped with Alfa Romeo engines built by the Italian Autotechnic. Pirelli will once again be the official tire supplier. The identities of the invited teams have not yet been revealed, but some news is expected in this field compared to 2024. To avoid any behind -the -scenes disputes, it has already been defined that “the position on the boxes for the teams that participate in the Macao Grand Prix will be based on the ranking of the previous year” and, in turn, “the position in the roadway for new teams will be attributed based on the order of application.” Equal awards and more restricted advertising The values ​​of monetary awards remain unchanged this year, with a total of US $ 68,500 to distribute, the equivalent of just over 550,000 patacas at the current exchange rate. The race winner will receive $ 12,000, an amount that is still far from covering the costs of participation in this nature. On the other hand, the sports regulation introduces two new prohibitions on advertising into the monoligales. In addition to the existing prohibition of advertising to fortune or bad luck, tobacco or pornography, also the promotion of electronic cigarettes and alcoholic beverages - a measure that follows the legislation in force in the territory. The 72nd Macao Grand Prix, the largest international sports event of the MSA, will take place between November 13 and 16, 2025.

item.title: MOTOR EMBALISM | Project for new track in Zhuhai emerges
